001package io.cyborgcode.roa.framework.assertion;
002
003import java.util.Map;
004import java.util.Optional;
005import java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap;
006import java.util.function.BiConsumer;
007import java.util.function.Predicate;
008import org.assertj.core.api.SoftAssertions;
009
010/**
011 * Custom extension of {@code SoftAssertions} with enhanced post-error handling capabilities.
012 *
013 * <p>This class provides additional functionality for managing assertion errors by allowing
014 * custom error handlers and associated objects to be registered and processed automatically.
015 *
016 * <p>Registered error handlers can define specific logic for handling assertion failures,
017 * including conditional checks based on stack traces.
018 *
019 * @author Cyborg Code Syndicate üíçüë®üíª
020 */
021public class CustomSoftAssertion extends SoftAssertions {
022
023   /**
024    * Stores objects required for post-error handling, mapped by their class type.
025    */
026   private final Map<Class<?>, Object> requiredObjectsForPostErrorHandling = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
027
028   /**
029    * Stores custom post-error handlers mapped to their corresponding class types.
030    */
031   private static final Map<Class<?>, BiConsumer<AssertionError, Object>> postErrorHandlers = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
032
033   /**
034    * Stores predicates to determine whether a post-error handler should be applied based on stack trace analysis.
035    */
036   private static final Map<Class<?>, Predicate<StackTraceElement[]>> errorCheckers = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
037
038   /**
039    * Registers an object to be used in post-error handling logic.
040    *
041    * @param clazz  The class type of the object.
042    * @param object The object to be registered for error handling.
043    * @param <T>    The type of the object being registered.
044    */
045   public <T> void registerObjectForPostErrorHandling(Class<T> clazz, T object) {
046      requiredObjectsForPostErrorHandling.put(clazz, object);
047   }
048
049   /**
050    * Retrieves an object of the specified type that was registered for post-error handling.
051    *
052    * @param clazz The class type of the requested object.
053    * @param <T>   The expected type of the object.
054    * @return An {@code Optional} containing the registered object, if available.
055    */
056   public <T> Optional<T> getObjectFromType(Class<T> clazz) {
057      return Optional.ofNullable(clazz.cast(requiredObjectsForPostErrorHandling.get(clazz)));
058   }
059
060   /**
061    * Collects an assertion error and processes it using registered custom handlers.
062    *
063    * <p>If an assertion failure occurs, the registered error handlers are invoked for
064    * any applicable objects, based on the stack trace and configured predicates.
065    *
066    * @param error The assertion error that occurred.
067    */
068   @Override
069   public void collectAssertionError(final AssertionError error) {
070      postErrorHandlers.forEach((clazz, handler) -> getObjectFromType(clazz).ifPresent(object -> {
071         if (errorCheckers.getOrDefault(clazz, stackTrace -> true).test(error.getStackTrace())) {
072            handler.accept(error, object);
073         }
074      }));
075      super.collectAssertionError(error);
076   }
077
078   /**
079    * Registers a custom error handler for a specific type.
080    *
081    * <p>The provided handler is executed when an assertion failure occurs, and can
082    * include an optional predicate to determine applicability based on the stack trace.
083    *
084    * @param clazz        The class type associated with the error handler.
085    * @param errorHandler A function that handles assertion errors for the specified type.
086    * @param errorChecker A predicate to determine whether the handler should be applied based on stack trace analysis.
087    * @param <T>          The type associated with the error handler.
088    */
089   public static <T> void registerCustomAssertion(Class<T> clazz,
090                                                  BiConsumer<AssertionError, T> errorHandler,
091                                                  Predicate<StackTraceElement[]> errorChecker) {
092      postErrorHandlers.put(clazz, (BiConsumer<AssertionError, Object>) errorHandler);
093      errorCheckers.put(clazz, errorChecker);
094   }
095
096}
